trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter to convert data for an image key to and from another data type.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter> class is used to convert key values of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageList> to and from other data types.

For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90373a3f-d8c8-492d-841c-945d62393c56).
Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter>.
Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter"></xref> class.
Returns whether this converter can convert an object of the given type to a string using the specified context.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that specifies the type you want to convert from.
`true` to indicate the specified conversion can be performed; otherwise, `false`.
Converts from the specified object to a string.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> to provide locale information.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to convert.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the converted value.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given object to the specified type.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from.
This parameter or properties of this parameter can be `null`.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> that provides locale information.
The object to convert, typically an image key.
The type to convert the object to.
An that represents the converted value.
destinationType is `null`.
The specified value could not be converted to the specified destinationType.
Returns a collection of standard image keys for the image list associated with the specified context.

If no image list is found, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter> supports `null` as a standard value, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method returns a collection containing a single empty string.
If no image list is found, and `null` is not supported as a standard value, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> returns an empty collection.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from.
This parameter or properties of this parameter can be `null`.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> that contains the standard set of image key values.

Determines whether the list of standard values for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter"></xref> is exclusive (that is, whether it allows values other than those returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues*"></xref>).
If the list returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method is exclusive, no other values are valid.
This is typical of an enumerated data type.
If the list is not exclusive, there are other valid values besides the list of standard values that <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> provides.
As implemented in this type converter, this method always returns `true`.

Typically, you should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method before you attempt to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> methods.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from.
This parameter or properties of this parameter can be `null`.
`true` to indicate the list does not allow additional values; otherwise, `false`.
Always returns `true`.
Determines whether this type converter supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.

As implemented in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter> class, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter.GetStandardValuesSupported%2A> method always returns `true` since <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageKeyConverter> supports a standard set of index values for images that can be picked from a list.

An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context, which can be used to extract additional information about the environment this type converter is being invoked from.
This parameter or properties of this parameter can be `null`.
`true` to indicate a list of standard values is supported; otherwise, `false`.
Always returns `true`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether `null` is valid in the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> collection.
`true` in all cases, indicating `null` is valid in the standard values collection.
